posts.post_content:
@Leonidus; Sure they do. In fact, they print cards like this with that very thought in mind. A lot of players like combos. If its not going to rock the tournament boards, they aren't going to care. EDIT; Okay, maybe you can attack with all of them since they have haste. I still don't hate this combo.

posts.post_content: Understandably, most comments here are about [Splinter Twin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Splinter Twin), but that ship has sailed. Still, this card is a powerhouse! Since rotation, the average toughness of utility creatures has dropped. Additionally, with there being a smaller card pool available now, people are falling back on the good ol' Titan cycle/and/or [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) for win conditions. Exarch can reliably slow your opponent down OR cripple their defenses, whether it's by tapping down a Titan, that untapped Island they were relying on, or netting yourself two blockers they weren't expecting. 5/5
posts.html:
Understandably, most comments here are about Splinter Twin, but that ship has sailed. Still, this card is a powerhouse! Since rotation, the average toughness of utility creatures has dropped. Additionally, with there being a smaller card pool available now, people are falling back on the good ol' Titan cycle/and/or Wurmcoil Engine for win conditions. Exarch can reliably slow your opponent down OR cripple their defenses, whether it's by tapping down a Titan, that untapped Island they were relying on, or netting yourself two blockers they weren't expecting. 5/5
